command.name: nop
command.info: Does absolutely nothing. Can be used as placeholder.

command.name: nop2
command.info: Does also absolutely nothing. Can be used as placeholder.

command.name: end
command.info: Terminates the script and exits the scripthandler.

command.name: return
command.info: Returns to the latest CALL statement and continues execution at that position.

command.name: call
command.info: Continues script execution from the specified offset. Can be returned to when calling RETURN.

param.name: Destination
param.info: A pointer to the offset to jump to. Can be a dynamic label or offset.

command.name: goto
command.info: Continues script execution from the specified offset.

param.name: Destination
param.info: A pointer to the offset to jump to. Can be a dynamic label or offset.

command.name: if {0} goto {1}
command.info: If the result of the last comparison matches the condition, script execution is continued from specified offset.

param.name: Condition
param.info: Read the user-manual to receive a list of valid conditions.

param.name: Destination
param.info: A pointer to the offset to jump to. Can be a dynamic label or offset.

command.name: if {0} call {1}
command.info: If the result of the last comparison matches the condition, script execution is continued from specified offset.

param.name: Condition
param.info: Read the user-manual to receive a list of valid conditions.

param.name: Destination
param.info: A pointer to the offset to jump to. Can be a dynamic label or offset.

command.name: gotostd
command.info: Jumps to the standard function at the given index.

param.name: Function index
param.info: The entry at the pointer table at INDEX will be called as a function.

command.name: callstd
command.info: Jumps to the standard function at the given index. Can be returned to when calling RETURN.

param.name: Function index
param.info: The entry at the pointer table at INDEX will be called as a function.

command.name: gotostdif
command.info: Jumps to the standard function if the specified condition is met to the latest comparison.

param.name: Condition
param.info: Read the user-manual to receive a list of valid conditions.

param.name: Function index
param.info: The entry at the pointer table at INDEX will be called as a function.

command.name: callstdif
command.info: Calls the standard function if the specified condition is met to the latest comparison.

param.name: Condition
param.info: Read the user-manual to receive a list of valid conditions.

param.name: Function index
param.info: The entry at the pointer table at INDEX will be called as a function.

command.name: jumpram
command.info: Executes a specific script that is stored at a default RAM location.

command.name: killscript
command.info: Terminates the script and writes zeroes to the RAM that involves scripting.

command.name: setbyte
command.info: Writes the given byte value as WORD to EWRAM address 0x0203AAA8.

command.name: setbank
command.info: Writes the specified word value to the script bank at the given index.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Number of the bank to write value to.

param.name: Value
param.info: Value to write to the bank.

command.name: setbank2
command.info: Writes the specified byte value to the script bank at the given index.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Number of the bank to write value to.

param.name: Value
param.info: Value to write to the bank.

command.name: writebyte
command.info: Writes the specified byte value to the given offset in the RAM.

param.name: Value
param.info: Value to write to the RAM offset.

param.name: Offset
param.info: RAM offset to write value to.

command.name: loadbyte
command.info: Loads the byte from a given RAM location to the specified script bank.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank to load the byte to.

param.name: Source offset
param.info: RAM offset to load value from.

command.name: loadbyte2
command.info: The reverse operation of LOADBYTE. Loads a byte from the specified script bank and stores it in the given RAM location.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank to load the byte from.

param.name: Destination offset
param.info: RAM offset to load value to.

command.name: copybank
command.info: Copies a word value from one script bank to another one.

param.name: Destination
param.info: Bank to copy the value to.

param.name: Source
param.info: Bank to load the byte from.

command.name: copybyte
command.info: Copies a byte value from one RAM offset to another one.

param.name: Destination offset
param.info: RAM offset to copy value to.

param.name: Source offset
param.info: RAM offset to load value from.

command.name: setvar
command.info: Changes the value of the given variable to the specified hword.

param.name: Variable
param.info: Variable to write hword value to.

param.name: Value
param.info: The hword value to write to variable.

command.name: addvar
command.info: Adds the given hword value to the specified variable.

param.name: Variable
param.info: Variable to add hword value to.

param.name: Value
param.info: The hword value to add to variable.

command.name: subvar
command.info: Substracts the given hword value from the specified variable.

param.name: Variable
param.info: Variable to substract hword value from.

param.name: Value
param.info: The hword value to substract from variable.

command.name: copyvar
command.info: Copies the value of one variable to another one.

param.name: Destination
param.info: Variable to write value to.

param.name: Source
param.info: Variable to fetch value from.

command.name: copyvar2
command.info: Copies the value of one variable to another one OR sets a value directly.

param.name: Destination
param.info: Variable to write value to.

param.name: Source
param.info: If source is a variable, copies the value. Otherwise, sets a hword value directly.

command.name: comparebanks
command.info: Casts the bank values to bytes and compares them afterwards.

param.name: First bank
param.info: The first bank to compare.

param.name: Second bank
param.info: The second bank to compare.

command.name: comparebanktobyte
command.info: Compares the least-significant byte of the script bank value to a byte value.

param.name: Bank
param.info: The bank to compare the byte value from.

param.name: Value
param.info: Value to compare to bank.

command.name: comparebanktobyte2
command.info: Acts like COMPAREBANKTOBYTE, but instead retrieves the byte value to compare from a RAM location

param.name: Bank
param.info: The bank to compare the byte value from.

param.name: RAM offset
param.info: The RAM offset to load the byte value from.

command.name: comparebytetobank
command.info: Acts like COMPAREBANKTOBYTE2, just with reversed parameters.

param.name: RAM offset
param.info: The RAM offset to load the byte value from.

param.name: Bank
param.info: The bank to compare the byte value from.

command.name: comparebytes
command.info: Compares a byte loaded from a RAM location to a given byte value.

param.name: RAM offset
param.info: The RAM offset to load the byte value from.

param.name: Value
param.info: Value to compare to value at RAM offset.

command.name: comparebytes2
command.info: Compares a byte from a RAM location to another byte from a RAM location.

param.name: RAM offset 1
param.info: The first RAM offset to load value from.

param.name: RAM offset 2
param.info: The second RAM offset to load value from.

command.name: compare
command.info: Compares the value of a variable to a given hword value.

param.name: Variable
param.info: Variable to compare to.

param.name: Value
param.info: Value to compare to variable.

command.name: comparevars
command.info: Compares the values of two given variables.

param.name: Variable 1
param.info: First variable to compare to.

param.name: Variable 2
param.info: Second variable to compare to.

command.name: callasm
command.info: Executes the machine code located at the given offset.

param.name: Routine
param.info: Specifies the offset of the routine.

command.name: copyasm
command.info: Copies the given routine offset to the RAM section that is used by the scripthandler.

param.name: Routine
param.info: Effects on replacing the previous ASM routine have not yet been investigated.

command.name: special
command.info: Calls a built-in special function at the given function index.

param.name: Function
param.info: Index in the special pointer table.

command.name: special2
command.info: Calls a built-in special function at the given function index and its return argument will be written to the variable.

param.name: Variable
param.info: The output of the function is stored in this variable.

param.name: Function
param.info: Index in the special pointer table.

command.name: waitstate
command.info: Pauses script execution until a routine manually resumes it. Can result in an infinite loop if used wrongly.

command.name: pause
command.info: Pauses script execution for the specified amount of frames.

param.name: Frames
param.info: 1 second = 59.71 frames (GBA refresh rate)

command.name: setflag
command.info: Sets the specified flag to 1, i.e. activates it.

param.name: Flag
param.info: ID of the flag to activate.

command.name: clearflag
command.info: Sets the specified flag to 0, i.e. deactivates it.

param.name: Flag
param.info: ID of the flag to deactivate.

command.name: checkflag
command.info: Determines whether the specified flag is activated or not.

param.name: Flag
param.info: ID of the flag to compare.

command.name: cmd2c
command.info: Does only exist in R/S/E. Purpose yet to discover.

command.name: checkdailyflags
command.info: Does only exist in R/S/E. Determines whether a day has passed.

command.name: gettime
command.info: R/S/E only. Stores hours, minutes and seconds into variables 0x8000-0x8002.

command.name: sound
command.info: Plays the given sound. If 0x0, all channels will be muted.

param.name: Sound
param.info: Index of the sound within the sound table.

command.name: waitsound
command.info: Pauses the script until the current sound (played via SOUND) has finished playing.

command.name: fanfare
command.info: Plays the given fanfare.

param.name: Fanfare
param.info: Can be either the index of the fanfare or a variable that contains the index.

command.name: waitfanfare
command.info: Pauses the script until the current fanfare (played via FANFARE) has finished playing.

command.name: playsong
command.info: Plays the given song. The second argument should always be set to 0x0!

param.name: Music
param.info: Index of the music within the music table.

param.name: Unknown
param.info: Appearantly is always 0x0.

command.name: playsong2
command.info: Plays the given song in another channel. The second argument should always be set to 0x0!

param.name: Music
param.info: Index of the music within the music table.

command.name: fadedefault
command.info: Fades the currently playing song into the map's default song.

command.name: fadesong
command.info: Fades the currently playing song into the specified song.

param.name: Music
param.info: Index of the music to fade to.

command.name: fadeout
command.info: Fades out the currently playing song with the specified speed.

param.name: Speed
param.info: 1 second = 59,71 frames (maximum of ~4.25 seconds possible)

command.name: fadein
command.info: Fades the currently playing song back in, with the specified speed.

param.name: Speed
param.info: 1 second = 59,71 frames (maximum of ~4.25 seconds possible)

command.name: warp
command.info: Warps to the specified bank/map at the given warp or position X/Y.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: warpmuted
command.info: Warps to the specified bank/map at the given warp or position X/Y but does not play a sound effect.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: warpwalk
command.info: Warps to the specified bank/map at the given warp or position X/Y. Player walking one step upwards.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: warphole
command.info: Warps to the specified bank/map to the same position as the current one. Player falling through the ground.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

command.name: warpteleport
command.info: Warps to the specified bank/map at the given warp or position X/Y. Player beeing teleported.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: warp3
command.info: Warps to the specified bank/map at the given warp or position X/Y. Differences to WARP yet to be discovered.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: setdefaultwarp
command.info: Sets the default warp location when player is attempted to be redirected to map 127 on bank 127.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: warp4
command.info: Does the same as warp3, but appearantly does not copy the map-header and events.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: warp4
command.info: Does the same as warp4, but in addition does not load any of the mapscripts and connections.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: getplayerpos
command.info: Retrieves the player's position on the map and stores it in the specified variables.

param.name: Variable X
param.info: This variable will contain the X-coordinate.

param.name: Variable Y
param.info: This variable will contain the Y-coordinate.

command.name: countpokemon
command.info: Retrieves the number of Pok√©mon in the party and stores it in variable 0x800D.

command.name: additem
command.info: Stores the given amount of the specified item in the player's bag. Variable 0x800D is set to 1 if successful.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: The amount of items to store.

command.name: removeitem
command.info: Removes the given amount of the specified item from the player's bag. If QUANTITY is above actual amount, will do nothing.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: The amount of items to remove.

command.name: checkitemroom
command.info: Determines whether the player has space for the item. Variable 0x800D is set to 1 if they have.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: The amount of items to remove.

command.name: checkitem
command.info: Determines whether the play has the given amount or more of the specified item.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: The amount of items to remove.

command.name: getitemtype
command.info: Retrieves the type of the given item and returns it to 0x800D. Read the user manual for advanced information.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: addpcitem
command.info: Adds the given amount of items to the player's PC.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: The amount of items to remove. Can also be a variable containing the amount.

command.name: checkpcitem
command.info: Checks if the player has the given amount or more of the specified item. Variable 0x800D will be 1, if they have.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: The amount of items to remove. Can also be a variable containing the amount.

command.name: adddecoration
command.info: R/S/E only. Adds the specified decoration to the player's PC. Variable 0x800D will be 1, if successful.

param.name: Decoration
param.info: Index of the decoration. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: removedecoration
command.info: R/S/E only. Removes the specified decoration from the player's PC.

param.name: Decoration
param.info: Index of the decoration. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: testdecoration
command.info: R/S/E only. Determines if the given decoration can be added to the player's PC. 0x800D will be 1, if yes.

param.name: Decoration
param.info: Index of the decoration. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: checkdecoration
command.info: R/S/E only. Determines if the given decoration exists in the player's PC. 0x800D will be 1, if yes.

param.name: Decoration
param.info: Index of the decoration. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: applymovement
command.info: Moves the specified person. 0xFF moves the player, 0x7F moves the camera.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The ID of the NPC to move. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Movement data offset
param.info: Offset of the movement data. Movement data is applied via "#move 0xMove".

command.name: applymovement2
command.info: Moves the person that was specified in the given variable.

param.name: Variable
param.info: Variable that contains the ID of the NPC to move.

param.name: Movement data offset
param.info: Offset of the movement data. Movement data is applied via "#move 0xMove".

command.name: waitmovement
command.info: Pauses script execution until the movement of the specified NPC ended.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: If 0x0, waits until ALL movements have been finished.

command.name: waitmovementpos
command.info: Waits until the player's movement ended OR if the movement crosses the given X/Y location.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: This should always be 0xFF (for the player).

param.name: X-coordinate
param.info: X-coo of the position at which player is forced to stop.

param.name: Y-coordinate
param.info: Y-coo of the position at which player is forced to stop.

command.name: hidesprite
command.info: Hides the person with the specified ID number.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to be hidden. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: hidespritelevel
command.info: Hides the sprite and moves it to a specific location. Triggers a permanent change in level-scripts.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to be hidden. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Specifies the X-position of the sprite to be moved.

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Specifies the Y-position of the sprite to be moved.

command.name: showsprite
command.info: Shows a previously hidden person with the specified ID number.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to be hidden. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: showspritelevel
command.info: Shows the sprite and moves it to a specific location. Triggers a permanent change in level-scripts.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to be shown. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Specifies the X-position of the sprite to be moved.

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Specifies the Y-position of the sprite to be moved.

command.name: movesprite
command.info: Moves a sprite to the specified location.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to move. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Specifies the X-position of the sprite to be moved.

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Specifies the Y-position of the sprite to be moved.

command.name: showsprite3
command.info: Shows a sprite from an external map at specified bank.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to be shown. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map on which the person is located at.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map on which the person is located at.

command.name: hidesprite3
command.info: Hides a sprite from an external map at specified bank.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to be hidden. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map on which the person is located at.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map on which the person is located at.

command.name: faceplayer
command.info: Faces the latestly asked person to the player.

command.name: spriteface
command.info: Changes the facing of the sprite. FACE_XXXX macroes are accepted by this function.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to be changed. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Facing
param.info: Can be FACE_XXXX macroes or their numeric representations.

command.name: trainerbattle
command.info: Starts a trainerbattle. Not all pointers are used, check out the user manuel for documentation.

param.name: Type
param.info: The type of the trainerbattle. Most common: 0x0 for single-trainer battle.

param.name: Index
param.info: The index of the trainer to battle.

param.name: Flag
param.info: Mostly set to 0x0. Set to 0x3 addition to type 0x9 (Oak's battle!)

param.name: Intro
param.info: Offset of text containing the intro string.

param.name: Outro
param.info: Offset of text containing the winning message.

param.name: Misc1
param.info: Can have different roles. Either unused, text or continuation. Check out the user manual.

param.name: Misc2
param.info: Can have different roles. Either unused, text or continuation. Check out the user manual.

command.name: repeattrainerbattle
command.info: Starts a trainer battle, given by RAM information. Basically starts the last battle again.

command.name: trainerbattlesuppressintro
command.info: Suppresses the intro message of the following trainerbattle command.

command.name: trainerbattlesuppressoutro
command.info: Suppresses the outro message of the following trainerbattle command.

command.name: checktrainerflag
command.info: Determines whether the given trainer has already been defeated. 0x800D will contain 1, if they are.

param.name: Trainer
param.info: Trainer must be either 0x500 + TrainerID or a variable containing it.

command.name: cleartrainerflag
command.info: Declares the specified trainer as DEFEATED.

param.name: Trainer
param.info: Trainer must be either 0x500 + TrainerID or a variable containing it.

command.name: settrainerflag
command.info: Declares the specified trainer as NOT DEFEATED.

param.name: Trainer
param.info: Trainer must be either 0x500 + TrainerID or a variable containing it.

command.name: movespritelevel
command.info: Moves the sprite to a specified location. Triggers a permanent change in level-scripts.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to move. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Specifies the X-position of the sprite to be moved.

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Specifies the Y-position of the sprite to be moved.

command.name: moveoffscreen
command.info: Moves the specified sprite out of sight (one tile above the top-left corner).

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to move. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: spritebehave
command.info: Changes the movement behaviour of the sprite. Triggers a permanent change in level-scripts.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The number of the person to move. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Movement
param.info: Movement behaviour. For a complete list of them, check out the user manual.

command.name: waitmsg
command.info: Waits for the box opened by SHOWMSG to fully render.

command.name: showmsg
command.info: Displays a MSGBOX of type 0x6, but does not pause script execution.

param.name: Text
param.info: Can be either a pointer to a text or 0x3000F14 (script bank 0, taking text pointer from there).

command.name: closemsg
command.info: Closes the box opened by SHOWMSG on any key-press.

command.name: lockall
command.info: Freezes all people that are in the current view.

command.name: lock
command.info: Freezes the person that the player is currently talking to.

command.name: releaseall
command.info: Resumes movements for all people in the current view. Also closes any message box.

command.name: release
command.info: Resumes movement for the person the player was talking to.

command.name: waitkeypress
command.info: Pauses the script execution until the player presses a key.

command.name: yesnobox
command.info: Displays a YES/NO choice-box at the specified coordinates. 0x800D will contain 1, if YES was clicked.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

command.name: multichoice
command.info: Displays a multichoice-box at the specified coordinates. 0x800D will either contain the zero-based index of the selection, or 0x7F if B was pressed.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: List index
param.info: Index of the multichoice in the multichoice-table.

param.name: Key-B
param.info: If 0x1 or higher, player can exit choice-box via the key "B".

command.name: multichoice2
command.info: Does the same as MULTICHOICE but also predetermines the inital cursor position.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: List index
param.info: Index of the multichoice in the multichoice-table.

param.name: Initial index
param.info: Initial cursor index position within the box.

param.name: Key-B
param.info: If 0x1 or higher, player can exit choice-box via the key "B".

command.name: multichoice3
command.info: Does the same as MULTICHOICE but splits up the entries to multiple rows.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Position measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: List index
param.info: Index of the multichoice in the multichoice-table.

param.name: Items per row
param.info: The number of items per row. Must be dividible by option-amount without any remainder.

param.name: Key-B
param.info: If 0x1 or higher, player can exit choice-box via the key "B".

command.name: showbox
command.info: Shows a rectangular box at given coordinates with specified size.

param.name: Left
param.info: Specifies the X-position of the box.

param.name: Top
param.info: Specifies the Y-position of the box.

param.name: Width
param.info: Specifies the width of the box.

param.name: Height
param.info: Specifies the height of the box.

command.name: hidebox
command.info: Hides a rectangular box at given coordinates with specified size.

param.name: Left
param.info: Specifies the X-position of the box.

param.name: Top
param.info: Specifies the Y-position of the box.

param.name: Width
param.info: Specifies the width of the box.

param.name: Height
param.info: Specifies the height of the box.

command.name: hidebox2
command.info: Hides a part of rectangular box at given absolute coordinates with specified size.

param.name: Left
param.info: Specifies the X-position of the box.

param.name: Top
param.info: Specifies the Y-position of the box.

param.name: Width
param.info: Specifies the width of the box.

param.name: Height
param.info: Specifies the height of the box.

command.name: showpokepic
command.info: Displays a box that contains the front sprite of the specified Pok√©mon.

param.name: Species
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon or variable containing the index.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Measured in blocks (8x8), not in pixels!

command.name: hidepokepic
command.info: Hides all boxes displayed with SHOWPOKEPIC. Do not call directly after SHOWPOKEPIC.

command.name: showcontestwinner
command.info: R/S/E only. Displays the painting of the latest winner Pok√©mon in contests.

command.name: braille
command.info: Displays braille characters. Linebreaks can not be applied, unless using BRAILLE2. Check out the user manual.

param.name: Text
param.info: Can be either a pointer to a text or 0x3000F14 (script bank 0, taking text pointer from there).

command.name: givepokemon
command.info: Gives the player the specified Pok√©mon at given level and holding given item.

param.name: Species
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon to give. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Level
param.info: Non-zero level of the Pok√©mon.

param.name: Item
param.info: Initial item for the Pok√©mon to hold.

param.name: Unknown 1
param.info: Should be zero. Might be meant to be padding or leftovers of possible implementations.

param.name: Unknown 2
param.info: Should be zero. Might be meant to be padding or leftovers of possible implementations.

param.name: Unknown 3
param.info: Should be zero. Might be meant to be padding or leftovers of possible implementations.

command.name: giveegg
command.info: Gives the player an egg of the specified Pok√©mon species.

param.name: Species
param.info: Specifies the index of the Pok√©mon.

command.name: setpkmnpp
command.info: Sets the amount of PP for the specified Pok√©mon in the party.

param.name: Slot
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon in the player's party.

param.name: Move
param.info: Index of the move of the selected Pok√©mon.

param.name: Amount
param.info: Amount of the new PP to have for this move.

command.name: checkattack
command.info: Determines whether at least one Pok√©mon in the party has the specified move. 0x800D will have the zero-based index within the party or 0x6 to indicate failure.

param.name: Move
param.info: Index of the move to check for.

command.name: bufferpokemon
command.info: Writes the name of a Pok√©mon to a given buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Species
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon to buffer. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: bufferfirstpokemon
command.info: Writes the name of the first party Pok√©mon to a given buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

command.name: bufferpartypokemon
command.info: Writes the name of a party Pok√©mon to a given buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Slot
param.info: Slot number of the Pok√©mon to buffer. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: bufferitem
command.info: Writes the name of an item to the specified buffer. Can also be a variable.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item to buffer. Can also be a variable.

command.name: bufferdecoration
command.info: R/S/E only. Writes the name of a deco to the specified buffer. Can also be a variable.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Decoration
param.info: Index of the decoration to buffer. Can also be a variable.

command.name: bufferattack
command.info: Writes the name of an attack to the specified buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Move
param.info: Index of the move to buffer. Can also be a variable.

command.name: buffernumber
command.info: Converts the given number to a string and puts it to the specified buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Number
param.info: Number to buffer or variable containing the number.

command.name: bufferstd
command.info: Writes a standard string to the specified buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Standard string
param.info: Index of the standard string to buffer. Can also be a variable.

command.name: bufferstring
command.info: Writes a string located at a given offset to the specified buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Text
param.info: Offset of the string to buffer.

command.name: pokemart
command.info: Offers a specified palette of products for sale.

param.name: Products
param.info: A pointer to a list containing the items. Check out the user manual for a guide.

command.name: pokemart2
command.info: Offers a specified palette of products for sale.

param.name: Products
param.info: A pointer to a list containing the items. Check out the user manual for a guide.

command.name: pokemart3
command.info: Offers a specified palette of products for sale.

param.name: Products
param.info: A pointer to a list containing the items. Check out the user manual for a guide.

command.name: onearmedbandit
command.info: Starts the one-armed bandit game of the game corner in FR/LG and R/S/E.

param.name: Index
param.info: Index of the one-armed bandit game to use. Needs further investigation.

command.name: cmd8a
command.info: R/S/E only. Purpose has yet to be discovered.

command.name: choosecontestpkmn
command.info: R/S/E only. Prompts the player to choose a Pok√©mon for the contest.

command.name: startcontest
command.info: R/S/E only. Starts a contest with the Pok√©mon specified in CHOOSECONTESTPKMN.

command.name: showcontestresults
command.info: R/S/E only. Displays the results of the latest Pok√©mon contest.

command.name: startcontestlink
command.info: R/S/E only. Starts a contest, but only with a valid wireless connection.

command.name: random
command.info: Generates a random number and stores it in the variable 0x800D (LASTRESULT).

param.name: Limit
param.info: The number will be between zero and (Limit - 1). Can also be a variable.

command.name: givemoney
command.info: Gives the specified money to the player, but only if the second argument is zero.

param.name: Value
param.info: Amount of cash to give to the player.

param.name: Give?
param.info: If this argument is zero, money will be given.

command.name: paymoney
command.info: Substracts the specified money from the player, but only if the second argument is zero.

param.name: Value
param.info: Amount of cash to remove from the player.

param.name: Give?
param.info: If this argument is zero, specified money will be removed.

command.name: checkmoney
command.info: Determines whether the player has enough money. Stores 0x1 into variable 0x800D, if they have.

param.name: Value
param.info: Amount of cash to check for.

param.name: Give?
param.info: If this argument is zero, specified money will be checked.

command.name: showmoney
command.info: Spawns a box showing how much money the player has at the specified position.

param.name: X-position
param.info: X-coordinate of the box in blocks (8x8) not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Y-coordinate of the box in blocks (8x8) not in pixels!

command.name: hidemoney
command.info: Hides the money-box at the specified coordinates.

param.name: X-position
param.info: X-coordinate of the box in blocks (8x8) not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Y-coordinate of the box in blocks (8x8) not in pixels!

command.name: updatemoney
command.info: Updates the money value in the money-box at the specified coordinates.

param.name: X-position
param.info: X-coordinate of the box in blocks (8x8) not in pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Y-coordinate of the box in blocks (8x8) not in pixels!

command.name: cmd96
command.info: Purpose has yet to be discovered.

command.name: fadescreen
command.info: Fades the screen to black/white or vice-versa.

param.name: Fading
param.info: 0x0 fades in, 0x1 fades out, 0x2 fades white in, 0x3 fades white out.

command.name: fadescreen2
command.info: Does the same as fadescreen, but after a specified delay.

param.name: Fading
param.info: 0x0 fades in, 0x1 fades out, 0x2 fades white in, 0x3 fades white out.

param.name: Delay
param.info: Measured in frames. 1 second = 59,71 frames!

command.name: darken
command.info: Executes a flash animation that makes the visible region smaller (in caves for example).

param.name: Size
param.info: Measuring currently under investigation.

command.name: lighten
command.info: Executes a flash animation that enlarges the visible region (in caves for example).

param.name: Size
param.info: Measuring currently under investigation.

command.name: showmsg2
command.info: Does the same as SHOWMSG.

param.name: Text
param.info: Can be either a pointer to a text or 0x3000F14 (script bank 0, taking text pointer from there).

command.name: doanimation
command.info: Executes the specified built-in animation.

param.name: Animation
param.info: Index of the animation to run. Check out the user manual for a complete list.

command.name: setanimation
command.info: Specifies the Pok√©mon to use for the next animation, if needed.

param.name: Animation
param.info: Index of the animation to run. Check out the user manual for a complete list.

param.name: Slot
param.info: Index of the party Pok√©mon to use. Can also be a variable containing the index.

command.name: waitanimation
command.info: Pauses script animation until the specified animation has finished.

param.name: Animation
param.info: Waits for the specified animation to finish, or zero to wait for all.

command.name: sethealingplace
command.info: Specifies the healing place for the player to return if their party faints.

param.name: Flightspot
param.info: A list of all the flightspots can be found in the user manual.

command.name: checkgender
command.info: Checks the player's gender. Returns 0x0 in 0x800D (LASTRESULT) if beeing a male, 0x1 if beeing a female.

command.name: cry
command.info: Plays the specified Pok√©mon's cry. Use WAITCRY to pause until cry finished.

param.name: Species
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon to cry. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Effect
param.info: Can either be 0x0 or 0x1. 0x1 creates some kind of hall effect, but needs investigation.

command.name: setmaptile
command.info: Changes the tile the specified position. Changes it permenantly when used in a level-script.

param.name: X-position
param.info: X-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Y-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Tile
param.info: The new tile-number to place at the specified position.

param.name: Movement
param.info: Does only accept 0x0 for granted movement permission and 0x1 for no permission.

command.name: resetweather
command.info: Requests a weather change to the default weather. Can be applied using DOWEATHER.

command.name: setweather
command.info: Requests a weather change to the specified weather. Can be applied using DOWEATHER.

param.name: Weather
param.info: Type of the weather. A list can be found in the user manual.

command.name: doweather
command.info: Changes the weather requested by RESETWEATHER or SETWEATHER.

command.name: tilebehave
command.info: Changes the behaviour of a tile when beeing stepped on.

param.name: Routine
param.info: Unfortunately relies fully on ASM. Picks the routine at the specified index.

command.name: setfooter
command.info: Changes the header data of the current map. Special 0x8E must be applied afterwards to refresh the map.

param.name: Footer
param.info: Number of the footer in the table. Check out the user manual for advanced information.

command.name: spriteheight
command.info: Changes the height of the specified sprite on the specified map.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: Index of the NPC to move. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the specified map.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map on which to move the NPC.

param.name: Level
param.info: Can be found in AdvanceMap. 0x4 = water, 0xC = walking, ...

command.name: restoreheight
command.info: Restores the height of the specified sprite on the specified map.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: Index of the NPC to move. Can also be a variable containing the index.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the specified map.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map on which to move the NPC.

command.name: createsprite
command.info: Creates a virtual sprite for one-time use in a script, for example.

param.name: Sprite
param.info: Sprite picture number to use.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The virtual NPC identifier to use for this sprite-

param.name: X-coordinate
param.info: X-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-coordinate
param.info: Y-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Movement behaviour
param.info: Movement behaviour of the sprite. Check out the user manual.

param.name: Facing
param.info: One of the FACE_XXX macroes or their numeric representations.

command.name: spritefacevirtual
command.info: Changes the facing of a virtual sprite.

param.name: NPC-ID
param.info: The virtual NPC identifier to use for this sprite-

param.name: Facing
param.info: One of the FACE_XXX macroes or their numeric representations.

command.name: dooropen
command.info: Requests the opening of a door at the specified position.

param.name: X-coordinate
param.info: X-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-coordinate
param.info: Y-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

command.name: doorclose
command.info: Requests the closing of a door at specified position.

param.name: X-coordinate
param.info: X-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-coordinate
param.info: Y-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

command.name: doorchange
command.info: Executes the requests by DOOROPEN or DOORCLOSE.

command.name: dooropen2
command.info: Requests the opening of a door at the specified position, but without animation.

param.name: X-coordinate
param.info: X-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-coordinate
param.info: Y-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

command.name: doorclose2
command.info: Requests the closing of a door at specified position, but without animation.

param.name: X-coordinate
param.info: X-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-coordinate
param.info: Y-coordinate in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

command.name: cmdb1
command.info: R/S/E only. Purpose yet to be investigated.

command.name: cmdb2
command.info: R/S/E only. Purpose yet to be investigated.

command.name: countcoins
command.info: Counts the player's coins and stores it in the given variable.

param.name: Variable
param.info: Will contain the amount of coins.

command.name: givecoins
command.info: Gives a specified quantity of coins.

param.name: Amount
param.info: Amount of coins to give.

command.name: paycoins
command.info: Removes a specified quantity of coins.

param.name: Amount
param.info: Amount of coins to remove.

command.name: setwildbattle
command.info: Prepares a wild battle. Start it with DOWILDBATTLE.

param.name: Species
param.info: Pok√©mon to battle against.

param.name: Level
param.info: Level of the opponent Pok√©mon.

param.name: Item
param.info: Item that the opponent Pok√©mon holds.

command.name: dowildbattle
command.info: Executes a wild battle. Returns state of the battle; read user manual.

command.name: showcoins
command.info: Shows a box that shows how many coins the player has.

param.name: X-position
param.info: X-position in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Y-position in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

command.name: hidecoins
command.info: Hides a coins-box. Arguments are not used which indicates that only ONE box can be shown at the same time.

param.name: X-position
param.info: Not used!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Not used!

command.name: updatecoins
command.info: Updates the currently visible coins-box.

param.name: X-position
param.info: X-position in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

param.name: Y-position
param.info: Y-position in blocks (8x8), not pixels!

command.name: addhiddenvariable
command.info: Adds 1 to the specified hidden variable.

param.name: Hidden variable
param.info: Index of the hidden variable (e.g. 0xF for healed Pok√©mon).

command.name: warpconditional
command.info: Works just like WARP, but does not have any effect in level-scripts.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: waitcry
command.info: Pauses the script execution until the latest cry finishes playing.

command.name: bufferboxname
command.info: Writes the name of the specified PC-box to the given buffer.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: 0x0 for first buffer, 0x1 for second, 0x2 for third.

param.name: Box
param.info: ID number of the box-name to buffer.

command.name: textcolor
command.info: Changes the text color of default message boxes (callstd 0x6).

param.name: Color
param.info: 0x0 for blue text, 0x1 for female, 0xFF for default and others for black.

command.name: cmdc8
command.info: Shows a help text-box with the specified string. Needs further investigation.

param.name: Text
param.info: Specifies the offset to the text. Can also be the first script-bank.

command.name: cmdc9
command.info: Provides clean-up after a help text-box was shown via cmdc8.

command.name: msgsign
command.info: After using this command, all default message boxes (0x6) will use the sign-post frame.

command.name: msgdefault
command.info: After using this command, all default message boxes (0x6) will use the default frame.

command.name: comparehiddenvar
command.info: Compares the value of a hidden variable to the specified value.

param.name: Hidden variable
param.info: Index of the hidden variable to compare

param.name: Value
param.info: Value to compare to the hidden variable.

command.name: setobedience
command.info: Makes the specified party Pok√©mon obedient.

param.name: Slot
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon in the party. Can also be a variable.

command.name: checkobedience
command.info: Determines whether the given party Pok√©mon is obedient. If yes, 0x1 will be writen to 0x800D (LASTRESULT).

param.name: Slot
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon in the party. Can also be a variable.

command.name: executeram
command.info: Under certain conditions, continues script execution from the offset specified at 0x020370A4.

command.name: setworldmapflag
command.info: Sets the specified worldmapflag to 1. Allows to visit that map using HM Fly.

param.name: Worldflag
param.info: The worldmapflag to set to 1, but only if a valid flying spot and byte at 0x0203ADFA greater than 0x3.

command.name: warpteleport2
command.info: Warps to the specified bank/map at the given warp or position X/Y. Player beeing teleported.

param.name: Bank
param.info: Bank of the map to warp to.

param.name: Map
param.info: Map to warp to.

param.name: Warp
param.info: Warp number to warp to. If beeing 0xFF, warps to the position specified in the following arguments.

param.name: X position
param.info: X position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

param.name: Y position
param.info: Y position to warp to. Only if WARP is 0xFF.

command.name: setcatchlocation
command.info: Changes the location of where a party Pok√©mon has been caught.

param.name: Slot
param.info: Index of the Pok√©mon in the party. Can also be a variable.

param.name: Location
param.info: Read the user manual to retrieve a list of valid locations.

command.name: measurebraille
command.info: Measures the width of the braille string and stores it in variable 0x8004.

param.name: Text
param.info: The offset of the braille string to measure. Can also be the first script-bank (0x3000F14)

command.name: bufferitems
command.info: Does the same as BUFFERITEM, but if there are multiple items, the string is pluralized.

param.name: Buffer
param.info: Can be either 0x0, 0x1 or 0x2.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item to buffer. Can also be a variable.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: Amount of items. Can also be a variable. If 2 or more, will be pluralized.

command.name: cmdd5
command.info: R/S/E only. Needs further investigation.

macro.name: msgbox
macro.info: Displays the specified text with given standard function.

param.name: Text
param.info: Offset of the text to display.

param.name: Type
param.info: Type of the box. Check out the user manual for all types.

macro.name: giveitem
macro.info: Gives an item, shows a message and plays a fanfare. Used for normal scripts.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item to give to the player.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: Amount of items to give to the player.

macro.name: giveitem2
macro.info: Gives an item, shows a message and plays a fanfare. Used for item NPCs.

param.name: Item
param.info: Index of the item to give to the player.

param.name: Quantity
param.info: Amount of items to give to the player.
